bibl.title: Letter from M.J. Rosenau to Henry Rose Carter, September 30, 1924

div1.p: Rosenau comments on Carter's "Epidemiology of Yellow Fever."

div1.head: Letter from M.J. Rosenau to Henry Rose Carter, September 30, 1924
div1.opener:
Book
Rosenau
HARVARD UNIVERSITY
MEDICAL SCHOOL
DEPARTMENT OF PREVENTIVE MEDICINE AND HYGIENE
Boston, Massachusetts.
September 30, 1924.
Dr. H. R. Carter,
The Westmorland,
2122 California Street, N. W.,
Washington, D. C.
Dear Dr. Carter:
div1.p:
I just finished reading your section on
the Epidemiology of Yellow Fever and hunger for more. The
best I can say for it is that it is Carteresque, which of
course means also that it is thorough and full of imagina-
tion and meat. I like the way it is written and I admire
the way you analyze the facts and the logic of the conclu-
sions. Of course you are always conservative and careful in
your statements, which is part of your dependability. I
wish now I could have other sections of your book to read in
advance.
